name: Sudden drop in the number of session
description:
This rule checks for a sudden drop in the number of sessions.
This rule is powered by a generic sudden drop/increase detector which is based on a modified version of the E-Divisive with Medians (EDM) algorithm for detection of changes in distribution of values of a given metric over the time.

fields.name: content
fields.value:
1. Check the server logs for any error messages or warnings related to the sudden drop in session count.
2. Verify that the application is running smoothly and there are no exceptions or crashes.
3. If the application is running fine, check if there are any scheduled maintenance activities or updates that could have caused a temporary decrease in the number of sessions.
4. Investigate if there are any changes in the user behavior or application usage pattern that might be responsible for the sudden drop in session count.
5. If none of the above steps provide an answer, consider increasing the monitoring frequency for this rule to get more detailed insights into the situation.

Additionally, you can also refer to the provided documentation for more information about the rule and its configuration options.

If you still encounter issues after trying these suggestions, please let me know and I will be happy to help further.

Thank you!
